DOC.brief_title: Selective Internal Radiotherapy ( SIRT ) Versus Transarterial Chemoembolisation ( TACE ) Treatment Cholangiocellular Carcinoma ( CCC ) .
DOC.criteria: ≥18 year Intrahepatic CCC , proven histology typical morphology cross sectional imaging elevate tumor marker ( CEA CA 199 ) Tumor confine liver At least one measurable lesion magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) Tumor load ≤ 50 % Preserved liver function ( Child Pugh A B ) ECOG performance status ≤2 Patients feasible curative treatment ( e.g . resection local ablation ) Previous TACE SIRT Prior Chemotherapy Child Pugh stage C ECOG Performance Status > 1 Tumor involvement > 50 % liver Extrahepatic tumor Serum Bilirubin > 2.0 mg/dl ; Serum Albumin 2.8 g/dl , Serum Creatinine > 2 mg/dl ; Leukocytes < 3000/ml ; Thrombocytes < 50000/ml Clinically apparent ascites ( ascites CT/MRI exclusion criterion ) Esophageal bleed last 3 month Hepatic encephalopathy Transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt ( TIPS ) Infiltration occlusion main portal vein Hepatofugal blood flow portal vein Hepatopulmonary shunt ≥ 20 % macroaggregated albumin scan ( MAAscan ) Contraindications angiography Pregnancy
